description: From Middle English prophetise, from Old French prophetisier, from Latin prophētizō, from Ancient Greek προφητίζω (prophētízō, “to prophesy”); surface analysis prophet +‎ -ize.

verbs.description: prophetize (third-person singular simple present prophetizes, present participle prophetizing, simple past and past participle prophetized)

entries.meaning: To act as a prophet; to prophesy; to make prophecies.
